greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sigma(sigma(...(sigma(n))...)) / n, where sigma (A000203) is iterated until a multiple of n is reached.
comment: The minimal number of iterations of the sigma function until a multiple of n is reached (after the initial n) is given in A019294.
See also the Cohen-te Riele links in A019276.
link: Graeme L. Cohen and Herman J. J. te Riele, Iterating the sum-of-divisors function, Experimental Mathematics, 5 (1996), pp. 93-100.
Experimental Mathematics, Volume 5 (1996) ["Outdated Archival Version" as of 2005.]
program: (MAGMA) f:=func<n|DivisorSigma(1, n)>; a:=[]; for n in [1..41] do k:=n; while f(k) mod n ne 0 do k:=f(k); end while; Append(~a,f(k) div n); end for; a; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Jan 11 2020
xref: Cf. A019276 (megaperfect numbers: where A019294 reaches records), A019276 (record values), A019294 (number of iterations needed to reach a multiple of n).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
